creator: erich@redhat.com
text: Currently the SSLProxyMachineCertificate do not support encrypted private keys, it would be great if an enhancement was made to allow for this.

creator: asfbugz@velox.ch
text:
Resolving as a duplicate, see bug 24031 comment 6 in particular.

For the sake of transparency, let me add that I'm not in support of adding such a feature - on the contrary, I think that 2.4 should be the last version with support for encrypted private keys, more background in these threads:

https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-dev/201311.mbox/%3C52838765.8020401%40velox.ch%3E

https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-dev/201402.mbox/%3C52F42FA2.1070607%40fifthhorseman.net%3E

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 24031 ***
